text:
Question 168) A building supply store sells two types of water tanks: type A and type B. Both have cylindrical shape and have the same volume, and the height of the type B water box is equal to 25% of the water tank height of type A.
If r denotes the radius of the type A water box, then the radius of the type B water box is
A) R 2
B) 2 r
C) 4 R
D) 5 r
E) 16 R
